info.title: Metafield
info.description:
Metafields are a flexible way to attach additional information to a Shopify resource (e.g. Product, Collection, etc.). Some examples of data stored using metafields include specifications, size charts, downloadable documents, release dates, images, or part numbers. Metafields are identified by an owner resource, a namespace, and a key and they store a value along with type information for that context.

Resources that can have metafields

  • Article
  • Blog
  • Collection
  • Smart Collection
  • Customer
  • Draft Order
  • Location
  • Order
  • Page
  • Product
  • Product Image
  • Product Variant
  • Shop

paths.description: Retrieves a list of metafields attached to a particular resource by using the resource's endpoint.
paths.summary: Retrieve a list of metafields from the resource's endpoint

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Retrieve only certain fields, specified by a comma-separated list of fields names.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to show on a page.

parameters.name: since_id
parameters.description: Show metafields created after the specified ID.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of data that the metafield stores in the `value` field. Refer to the list of supported types.

parameters.name: updated_at_max
parameters.description: Show metafields last updated before date (format: 2022-02-25T16:15:47-04:00)

parameters.name: updated_at_min
parameters.description: Show metafields last updated after date (format: 2022-02-25T16:15:47-04:00)

200.description: Retrieve a list of metafields from the resource's endpoint

metafields.description: This field keeps track of the type of display
This field is for buyer notes

x-examples.name: Retrieve metafields attached to a Blog

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X GET "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-10/blogs/382285388/metafields.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
)

ShopifyAPI::Metafield.all(
  session: test_session,
  metafield: {"owner_id" => "382285388", "owner_resource" => "blog"},
)

x-examples.name: Retrieve metafields attached to a Product

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X GET "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-10/products/632910392/metafields.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
)

ShopifyAPI::Metafield.all(
  session: test_session,
  metafield: {"owner_id" => "632910392", "owner_resource" => "product"},
)

paths.description: Retrieves a list of metafields that belong to a resource by using query parameters.
paths.summary: Retrieve a list of metafields by using query parameters

parameters.name: metafield[owner_id]
parameters.description: Filter by the resource ID on which the metafield is attached to.

parameters.name: metafield[owner_resource]
parameters.description: Filter by the resource name on which the metafield is attached to.

200.description: Retrieve a list of metafields by using query parameters

metafields.description: This field keeps track of the type of display
This field is for buyer notes

x-examples.name: Retrieve metafields attached to a Blog

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X GET "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-10/metafields.json?metafield%5Bowner_id%5D=382285388&metafield%5Bowner_resource%5D=blog" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
)

ShopifyAPI::Metafield.all(
  session: test_session,
  metafield: {"owner_id" => "382285388", "owner_resource" => "blog"},
)

x-examples.name: Retrieve metafields attached to a Product

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X GET "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-10/metafields.json?metafield%5Bowner_id%5D=632910392&metafield%5Bowner_resource%5D=product" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
)

ShopifyAPI::Metafield.all(
  session: test_session,
  metafield: {"owner_id" => "632910392", "owner_resource" => "product"},
)

response.body: {"metafields":[{"id":915396079,"namespace":"notes","key":"buyer","value":"Notes about this buyer","description":"This field is for buyer notes","owner_id":450789469,"created_at":"2022-10-03T12:15:55-04:00","updated_at":"2022-10-03T12:15:55-04:00","owner_resource":"order","type":"single_line_text_field","admin_graphql_api_id":"gid://shopify/Metafield/915396079"}]}

paths.description: Get a count of all metafields that belong to a particular resource.
paths.summary: Retrieve a count of a resource's metafields.

200.description: Retrieve a count of a resource's metafields.

x-examples.name: Retrieve a count of metafields attached to a Page

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
)

ShopifyAPI::Metafield.count(
  session: test_session,
  page_id: 131092082,
)

paths.description: Retrieve a metafield by specifying the ID. All fields of a metafield are returned unless specific fields are named.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Retrieve only certain fields, specified by a comma-separated list of fields names.

metafield.description: This field is for buyer notes

paths.description:
You can create any number of metafields for a resource.
          To create metafields, use the corresponding resource's endpoint as listed on the examples.

x-examples.name: Create a metafield for the Shop resource

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -d '{"metafield":{"namespace":"inventory","key":"warehouse","value":25,"type":"number_integer"}}' \
-X POST "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-10/metafields.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json"

x-examples.name: Create a metafield for an article

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -d '{"metafield":{"namespace":"my_fields","key":"category","type":"single_line_text_field","value":"outdoors"}}' \
-X POST "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-10/articles/674387490/metafields.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json"

response.body: {"errors":{"type":["can't be blank"],"namespace":["can't be blank","is too short (minimum is 3 characters)"],"key":["can't be blank","is too short (minimum is 3 characters)"]}}

x-examples.name: Creating a metafield without a key will fail and return an error

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -d '{"metafield":{"key":null}}' \
-X POST "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-10/metafields.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json"

x-examples.name: Create a metafield for a draft order

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -d '{"metafield":{"namespace":"my_fields","key":"purchase_order","type":"single_line_text_field","value":"97453"}}' \
-X POST "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-10/draft_orders/622762746/metafields.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json"

x-examples.name: Create a metafield for a blog

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -d '{"metafield":{"namespace":"my_fields","key":"sponsor","type":"single_line_text_field","value":"Shopify"}}' \
-X POST "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-10/blogs/382285388/metafields.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json"

x-examples.name: Create a metafield for a collection

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -d '{"metafield":{"namespace":"my_fields","key":"discount","type":"single_line_text_field","value":"25%"}}' \
-X POST "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-10/collections/482865238/metafields.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json"

paths.description: Deletes a metafield by its ID.
paths.summary: Deletes a metafield by its ID

200.description: Deletes a metafield by its ID

x-examples.name: Delete a metafield by its ID for a Product Image

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X DELETE "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-10/product_images/850703190/metafields/625663657.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
)

ShopifyAPI::Metafield.delete(
  session: test_session,
  product_image_id: 850703190,
  id: 625663657,
)

properties.description: The date and time (ISO 8601 format) when the metafield was created.
properties.name: created_at

properties.description: A description of the information that the metafield contains.
properties.example: The number of units at the warehouse.
properties.name: description

properties.description: The unique ID of the metafield.
properties.name: id

properties.description: The key of the metafield. Keys can be up to 64 characters long and can contain alphanumeric characters, hyphens, underscores, and periods.
properties.name: key

properties.description:
A container for a group of metafields.
          Grouping metafields within a namespace prevents your metafields from conflicting with other metafields with the same key name.
          Must have between 3-255 characters.
properties.name: namespace

properties.description: The unique ID of the resource that the metafield is attached to.
properties.name: owner_id

properties.description: The type of resource that the metafield is attached to.
properties.name: owner_resource

properties.description: The date and time (ISO 8601 format) when the metafield was last updated.
properties.name: updated_at

properties.description: The data to store in the metafield. The value is always stored as a string, regardless of the metafield's type.
properties.name: value

properties.description: The type of data that the metafield stores in the `value` field. Refer to the list of supported types.
properties.name: type
